alert.note: Alert for Carlton (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 9:54AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota... St. Louis River At Scanlon affecting Carlton County. .Rain on top of the existing snowpack this weekend will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Louis River At Scanlon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water encroaches buildings near River Gate Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CDT Friday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.5 feet tomorrow evening. Additional precipitation is expected over the weekend. This river forecast contains 24 hours of forecast precipitation. Additional river rises are expected beyond this weekend. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 04/23/1979. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon St. Louis River Scanlon 10.5 11.6 Fri 8 am CDT 13.3 13.5 12.9 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon by 530 PM CDT.
